title: Syria war: John Kerry urges planes to be grounded
summary: US Secretary of State John Kerry calls for all planes to be grounded in key areas of Syria to save a truce, after an attack on an aid convoy.

title: Charlotte police: Keith Scott was warned to drop gun
summary: North Carolina officers issued repeated "loud, clear, verbal commands" to an armed man to drop his gun before shooting him, a police chief said.

title: Two sought over unexploded NY device
summary: The FBI is seeking two men pictured with a suitcase that allegedly contained a bomb that failed to explode in New York on Saturday.

title: Canada Prince Edward Island schools evacuated after 'hoax'
summary: All the schools on Canada's Prince Edward Island were evacuated due to a threat that turned out to be a likely hoax, police say.

title: Donald Trump says black communities 'in worst shape ever'
summary: Donald Trump declares that African Americans are "in the worst shape they've ever been", speaking in a town named after a slaveholder.

title: Egypt migrant boat capsize: At least 29 people killed
summary: At least 29 people drown after a migrant boat carrying about 600 passengers capsizes off the Egyptian coast, officials say.

title: Global pledge to stamp out drug-resistant infections
summary: The 193 countries of the United Nations have agreed a landmark declaration to rid the world of drug-resistant infections or superbugs.

title: Turkey attacker shot at Israel embassy in Ankara
summary: A man wielding a knife has been shot and wounded by security staff outside Israel's embassy in the Turkish capital, Ankara.

title: Brad Pitt 'saddened' by Angelina Jolie divorce
summary: Actor Brad Pitt says he is "very saddened" that wife Angelina Jolie has filed for divorce and asks for privacy on their children's behalf.

title: Philippines' Duterte fierce attack on 'hypocritical' EU
summary: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte calls European Parliament members who questioned extra-judicial killings "hypocrites" during an expletive-laden rant.

title: VW hit by flood of new lawsuits in emissions scandal
summary: Volkswagen is facing €8.2bn in damages claims from 1,400 German investors over the emissions scandal, a state court has said.

title: Berlin Pirate politician Claus-Brunner in 'murder-suicide'
summary: A politician in Germany's Pirate party is found dead in a Berlin flat with the body of another man, in what police believe was a murder-suicide.

title: Mobile phone roaming charge abolition plan rewritten
summary: Proposed time limits on cost-free roaming for travellers with mobile devices have been scrapped under new European Commission plans.

title: Zimbabwean 'flag abusers' face jail
summary: Zimbabweans risk imprisonment for abusing the national flag, the authorities warn in the wake of protests where the flag is used as a symbol for change.

title: Syria: Kerry urges Russia 'to come clean' over air strikes
summary: US Secretary of State John Kerry told the UN Security Council that Russia needed to take responsibility for recent air strikes in Syria.

title: 'I cried all day' over US bomb blasts

title: 'Police didn't give my brother a chance'
summary: The sister of a motorist shot dead by police in Oklahoma has told BBC's World Have Your Say how heartbroken she feels about his death.

title: Children dying of starvation in Yemen's conflict
summary: The war in Yemen, which began early last year when the government was overthrown by rebel forces, has pushed the country to the brink of famine. This video contains distressing scenes from the start. See more from BBC Our World's documentary Starving Yemen this weekend on BBC World, BBC News and iPlayer.

title: US protests after police shoot black man
summary: There have been violent protests in the US town of Charlotte, in North Carolina, after police shot dead a black man.

title: How fashion has left these dogs gasping for air
